Date:  Fri, 07 Jul 2017 11:59:42 -0600
From:  Alan Hale 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] continuing . . .
Hello everyone,

First off, I would like to extend my appreciation to all of you who wrote me
warm, encouraging letters of support. That really meant a lot . . . And I
would further like to extend my appreciation to those of you who granted
permission to link to their image galleries and to utilize their images.
I¹ve received a couple of permissions just very recently and I will
incorporate them soon, and meanwhile I will continue to track down others.

Anyway, ³Continuing With Comets² is now live:
http://www.earthriseinstitute.org/comets1.html (a few days later than I had
originally planned, but, as the adage goes, ³better late than never²). This
is part of a reworked Earthrise web site (http://www.earthriseinstitute.org)
that includes a link to a long personal statement that explains why the site
was essentially dormant for almost four years, and why I am reactivating it
now.

Once again, thanks to everyone for being a part of this with me.

Sincerely,
Alan

>

Date:  Wed, 19 Jul 2017 13:20:46 +0200
From:  Gianluca Masi 
Subject:  (457175) 2008 GO98: 17 July 2017
Dear All,

here it is an image of this intriguing object, grabbed a couple of night ago:

https://www.virtualtelescope.eu/2017/07/19/cometary-activity-457175-2008-go98-image-17-july-2017/

The image was obtained remotely using the 17" robotic unit part of the Virtual
Telescope project in Italy.

best
Gianluca 

Date:  Wed, 19 Jul 2017 06:48:01 -0500
From:  "P. Clay Sherrod" 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] (457175) 2008 GO98: 17 July 2017
The asteroid 457175 continues to clearly exhibit nebulosity; At Arkansas Sky
Observatories, we obtained a prime focus image with short enough exposure (single
shot) on July 18 to capture the outgassing as well as the central body; I measured
the total magnitude at 18.5, with a 9" coma.
Image is posted on the ASO web site.
http://arksky.org/calendar/alerts/771-cometary-nature-of-asteroid-457175
------------
Dr. Clay

Arkansas Sky Observatories
WEB: www.arksky.org/
FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/groups/421163751426836/
[Latest books from Clay Sherrod at: http://arksky.org/publications
ASO Petit Jean Mountain /MPC H41
ASO Petit Jean Mountain South /MPC H45
ASO West Conway /MPC H43
.......serving astronomy since 1971

Date:  Mon, 24 Jul 2017 21:14:26 +0200
From:  Erik Bryssinck 
Subject:  images comet C/2017 O1   -  23/7 + 24/7
On CCD-Images on on July 19th , the new comet C/2017 O1 was discovered by the "All-Sky Automated Survey for Supernovae" (ASASSN) program,

Used telescope was a 14-cm "Cassius" survey telescope at Cerro Tololo

Comet C/2017 O1 perihelion is on 14 oct.2017 and comet should be then on a distance of about 1.5 AU from the sun and about 0.72 from earth according the preliminary parabolic orbital elements (closest approach to the earth is about 17 oct.2017) – This could be a nice comet to observe further.

C/2017 O1 is now ( 24 july) on a distance of 1.63 AU from earth and 1.88 AU from the sun.

Images:

23 july

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/c2017o1_20170723.html

24 july: ( and af(rho) )

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/c2017o1_20170724.html

___________________________________

kind regards,

Erik Bryssinck & F.-J. Hambsch

ROAD Observatory (MPC:G39)

BRIXIIS Observatory (MPC:B96)

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/

___________________________________

CARA - Cometary Archive for Af(rho) : http://cara.uai.it

VVS - Belgian association for amateur astronomers : http://www.vvs.be

Date:  Sat, 29 Jul 2017 19:11:36 +0000
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2017 O1 ASASSN (Jul 28, 2017)
Object/Date:
Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) @ Jul.28,2017 02:43 UT

Description:
New comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN imaged on July 28th 2017, was discovered during an abrupt increase of brightness until the magnitude 10 at present. As seen in this image has developed a green gassy coma of diatomic carbon, with an appearent size of 10 arcminutes. This comet can reach a maximum brightness around 7th magnitude on next october when be observable from northern hemisphere passing near celestial zenit. There are some galaxies in this field, at right NGC 1084 and at bottom-left NGC 1110 edgeways.

Tech data:
GSO 8" f/3.7 & Atik 383L+ (L:5×240s Bin1 + RGB:3x120s Bin2) from Hoya Redonda, Valencia (Spain)

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/2017o1-asassn-20170728/

Clear and dark skies.

________________________________
José J. Chambó
(Valencia, Spain)

blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo 

Date:  Sat, 29 Jul 2017 20:02:29 +0000
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2017 O1 ASASSN (Jul 28, 2017)
I cant wait to get my scope on this one! Were in our maximum monsoon now, so not much chance to see any sky for months. Good image you have there, very nice colors!

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Subject: [Comet-Images] C/2017 O1 ASASSN (Jul 28, 2017)
To: "Comet images"
Date: Saturday, July 29, 2017, 12:11 PM

Object/Date:
Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN)  @ Jul.28,2017 02:43
UT

Description:
New comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN imaged on July 28th 2017,
was discovered during an abrupt increase of brightness until
the magnitude 10 at present. As seen in this image has
developed a green gassy coma of diatomic carbon, with an
appearent size of 10 arcminutes.
This comet can reach a maximum brightness around 7th
magnitude on next october when be observable from northern
hemisphere passing near celestial zenit. There are some
galaxies in this field, at right NGC 1084 and at bottom-left
NGC 1110 edgeways.

Tech data:
GSO 8" f/3.7 & Atik 383L+ (L:5×240s Bin1
+ RGB:3x120s Bin2) from Hoya Redonda, Valencia
(Spain)

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/2017o1-asassn-20170728/

Date:  Sat, 29 Jul 2017 16:34:13 -0500
From:  "P. Clay Sherrod" 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2017 O1 ASASSN (Jul 28, 2017)
Several images that I have received (posted on the ASO Facebook page) have revealed a
very "disk-like" central condensation; one in particular by Efrain Morales Rivera
https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=1494201440642353&set=p.1494201440642353&type=3&theater
shows considerable mottling in the structure of the outer coma; this is one to watch.
------------
Dr. Clay

Arkansas Sky Observatories
WEB: www.arksky.org/
FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/groups/421163751426836/
[Latest books from Clay Sherrod at: http://arksky.org/publications
ASO Petit Jean Mountain /MPC H41
ASO Petit Jean Mountain South /MPC H45
ASO West Conway /MPC H43
.......serving astronomy since 1971

On Sat, 7/29/17, Jos� J. Chamb� jjchambo@hotmail.com [Comet-Images]
wrote:

Subject: [Comet-Images] C/2017 O1 ASASSN (Jul 28, 2017)
To: "Comet images"
Date: Saturday, July 29, 2017, 12:11 PM

Object/Date:
Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) @ Jul.28,2017 02:43
UT

Description:
New comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN imaged on July 28th 2017,
was discovered during an abrupt increase of brightness until
the magnitude 10 at present. As seen in this image has
developed a green gassy coma of diatomic carbon, with an
appearent size of 10 arcminutes.
This comet can reach a maximum brightness around 7th
magnitude on next october when be observable from northern
hemisphere passing near celestial zenit. There are some
galaxies in this field, at right NGC 1084 and at bottom-left
NGC 1110 edgeways.

Tech data:
GSO 8" f/3.7 & Atik 383L+ (L:5�240s Bin1
+ RGB:3x120s Bin2) from Hoya Redonda, Valencia
(Spain)

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/2017o1-asassn-20170728/

Clear and dark skies.

Jos� J.
Chamb�
(Valencia,
Spain)

blog:
cometografia.es

twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo

------------------------------------
Posted by: Chris Schur
------------------------------------

Date:  Fri, 25 Aug 2017 07:55:19 -0500
From:  "P. Clay Sherrod" 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] (457175) 2008 GO98: 23 Aug. 2017
Clearly cometary in physical structure and appearance of course; we have been
following this for about year now with continuous reports of its cometary nature; it
is surprising how this is being virtually ignored by those who should be taking this
sudden and long-lasting transformation seriously.
Very nice image, Gianluca....

------------
Dr. Clay

Arkansas Sky Observatories
WEB: www.arksky.org/
FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/groups/421163751426836/
[Latest books from Clay Sherrod at: http://arksky.org/publications
ASO Petit Jean Mountain /MPC H41
ASO Petit Jean Mountain South /MPC H45
ASO West Conway /MPC H43
.......serving astronomy since 1971
____________________

>>

>>
>> The image was obtained remotely using the 17" robotic unit part of the Virtual
>> Telescope Project in Italy.
>>

Date:  Mon, 28 Aug 2017 09:49:43 +0200
From:  Luc ARNOLD 
Subject:  2017-08-26+27 C2016N6 C2016M1 29P(outburst at mag 12)
Hello everyone
Here are my observations for the last two nights, in filter Sloan r'

C/2016 N6 (PANSTARRS)
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2016N6_PANSTARRS.html

C/2016 M1 (PANSTARRS)
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2016M1_PANSTARRS.html

29P/S-W
This comet had an outburst close before 23.8 Aug, reaching about mag 14,
and I measured it at mag 14.3 on 26.9 Aug.
But the comet had a second outburst within the last 24h: I observed it
at mag 12.0 on 27.9 Aug.
This second outburst was confirmed by JF Soulier at W96 and D Banberger
at Z80.
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/29P_2017.html

Best
Luc 
Date:  Mon, 28 Aug 2017 18:25:52 +0700
From:  Mikhail Maslov 
Subject:  observations on 19/20 August
Hello,

Results of observations on 19/20 August:

- C/2015 O1 PanSTARRS

- C/2016 M1 PanSTARRS

- C/2014 OE4 PanSTARRS

- /2017 M4 ATLAS

- C/2015 ER61 PanSTARRS

- C/2017 O1 ASSASN

- C/2015 ER61 PanSTARRS and Pleiades with f=300 mm

- C/2017 O1 ASSASN with f=300 mm

http://newvega.nsu.ru/2017/08/28/observations-2017-08-1920/

Best regards,

Mikhail Maslov

Date:  Thu, 31 Aug 2017 11:35:59 +0000
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2017 O1 ASASSN (Aug. 4 & 22, 2017)
Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) @ Aug.4,2017 03:00 UT

Comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN imaged on August 4th 2017. Since last image I have took a week ago, its coma keeps with 10' long although seem that the central condensation is brighter. But the news is apparition of a dust tail whith near 5' long from said concentration toward southwest (to down right).

GSO 8" f/3.8 & Atik 383L+ (L:5×240s Bin1 + RGB:1x120s Bin2) from Llosa de Ranes, Valencia (Spain)

http://cometografia.es/2017o1-asassn-20170804/

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) @ Aug.22,2017 03:35 UT

Comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN imaged on August 22th 2017 continues evolving. One month after be discovered its brightness has increased until magnitude 9 and its tail continues growing. In this image is evident with 10' lenght, although seems more long and shaped as ionic tail.

GSO 8" f/3.8 & Atik 383L+ (L:6×120s Bin1 + RGB:1x120s Bin2) from Vallés, Valencia (Spain)

http://cometografia.es/2017o1-asassn-20170822/

Clear and dark skies.

________________________________
José J. Chambó
(Valencia, Spain)

blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo

Date:  Mon, 11 Sep 2017 19:14:11 +0000
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  Comet 71P/Clark (Jun.18, 2017)
With delay, but for the record its apparition:

Object/Date:
Comet 71P/Clark @ June 18,2017 11:38 UT

Description:
Comet 71P/Clark imaged on 18th June 2017 after its maximum approah to Earth when reached its brightest magnitude in this aparition with 10,5. In this image shows a greenish coma with 7' diameter in a very faint external layer wich wraps a central part more condensed, but no trace of tail.

Tech data:
Planewave 20" CDK 2259 mm. f/4.4 & FLI-PL09000 (L:4×180s Bin1 + RGB:1x120s Bin2) from Siding Spring, Australia

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/71p-clark-20170618/

Clear and dark skies.

________________________________
José J. Chambó
(Valencia, Spain)

blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo

Date:  Mon, 18 Sep 2017 20:55:43 +0000
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  Comets C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) & C/2015 ER61 (PANSTARRS) (Sep.17, 2017)
Object/Date:
Comets C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) & C/2015 ER61 (PANSTARRS) @ Sep 17,2017 09:47 UT

Description:
Comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN, down left, is observable by binoculars now while approaching to perihelion showing a greenish coma of diatomic carbon and a small ionic tail. At same time comet C/2015 ER61 PANSTARRS, up right, moving away since four months ago and twice as far from Earth, can be still imaged with a long and narrow tail. Between both is glimpsed a shred of IFN (Integrated Flux Nebula) very near to Pleiades located next to field toward the top right.

Tech data:
Takahashi FSQ-106ED f/5.0 & SBIG STL-11000M (L:4×180s Bin1 + RGB:1x60s Bin2) from Mayhill, New Mexico (USA)

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/2017o1-asassn-2015er61-panstarrs-20170917/

Clear and dark skies.

________________________________
José J. Chambó
(Valencia, Spain)

blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo

Date:  Thu, 21 Sep 2017 11:47:35 +0000
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  Comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN (Sep.18,2017)
Object/Date:
Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) @ Sep.18,2017 04:24 UT

Description:
Comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN photographed on September 18th 2017. Comparing this image with I took a month ago is seen as have increased the apparent size of its greenish coma from 7' to 10', and the lenght of its ionic tail from 10' to 20'. Its brightness has slightly increased on same time from magnitude 9 to 8.5 approximately. The brightest star in field is 37 Tauri with magnitude 4,4.

Tech data:
GSO 8" 760mm. f/3.8 & Atik 383L+ (L:3×120s Bin1 + RGB:1x90s Bin2) from Vallés, Valencia (Spain)

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/2017o1-asassn-20170918/
[http://cometografia.es/wp-content/photo-gallery/2017/2017O1_170918_1200.jpg]

Cometa C/2017 O1 ASASSN (18-Sep-2017) | Cometografía
cometografia.es
El cometa C/2017 O1 ASASSN ha aumentado el diámetro de su coma y la longitud de la cola iónica, incrementando su brillo hasta la magnitud 8,5.

Clear and dark skies.

________________________________
José J. Chambó
(Valencia, Spain)

blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo

Date:  Sat, 23 Sep 2017 13:10:42 +0200
From:  Bernhard Häusler 
Subject:  Comet C/2016 N4 (MASTER) on 2017-09-22 from K87
Hi,

pretty bad sky conditions, but the tail is clearly visible.

composed 35 60sec. exposures, 2017-09-22 UT21:37, 0.30-m f/1873.1mm SCT + CCD
16.29 mag, coma: 30", tail: 4'30' in PA150

http://www.b82maidbronn.de/c2016n4_20170922.htm
http://www.b82maidbronn.de/c2016n4.htm

CS
Bernhard
K87 Dettelbach Vineyard Observatory

http://www.b82maidbronn.de/index.htm

Date:  Wed, 27 Sep 2017 13:30:36 +0000
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  Comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN (Sep.25,2017)
Object/Date:
Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) @ Sep.25,2017 04:05 UT

Description:
Comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN photographed on September 25th 2017, keeping its morphological shape with a coma of 8' diameter and tail about 15' long. Located in this image into constellation Taurus and above a zone of dark clouds of dust wich hidde the starry background.

Tech data:
GSO 8" 760mm. f/3.8 & Atik 383L+ (L:3×120s Bin1 + RGB:1x90s Bin2) from Vallés, Valencia (Spain)

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/2017o1-asassn-20170925/

Clear and dark skies.

________________________________
José J. Chambó
(Valencia, Spain)

blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo

with a direct link to the image:

Date:  Tue, 03 Oct 2017 05:04:24 +0000
From:  jbrimaco@bigpond.net.au
Subject:  Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) Widefield and Narrowfield Oct 1
Taken from New Mexico Skies using a Canon 5D Mk IV and 135 mm lens for the widefield image and
an SBIG STXL-6303 and 43-cm CDK for the narrowfield image

The widefield shot includes the Northern Trifid and Mankin's Nebulae.

LINK
Positive image: https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/36756934394/
Negative image: https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/36756934624/
Widefield Color https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/36756934394/

Clear still skies
Joe

Joseph Brimacombe
Coral Towers Obsevatory

Cairns, Australia

is C/2017 O1 alongside NGC 1579  on October
2nd.

Date:  Sat, 14 Oct 2017 17:48:31 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet C/2017 O1 at perihelion (with NGC 1624.)
Hi all
Today comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) reached perihelion. It was also placed very close to the small open cluster/emission nebula NGC 1624 in Perseus.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2017o1_2017_10_14dp.jpg

24"CDK with FLI camera. HaLRGB. 40mins total.
Best Wishes
Damian *************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

Subject: [Comet-Images] Comet C/2017 O1 at perihelion (with NGC 1624.)

Hi all

Today comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) reached perihelion. It was also placed very
close to the small open cluster/emission nebula NGC 1624 in Perseus.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2017o1_2017_10_14dp.jpg

24"CDK with FLI camera. HaLRGB. 40mins total.

Best Wishes

Damian

*************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

Date:  Sun, 15 Oct 2017 16:28:32 +0000
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet Asassin C/2017 O1 on October 14th
HI all,

Comet Asassin C/2017 O1 on October 14th

As the comet finally makes it into the evening sky, it passes right on top of a very dense starfield in Perseus! The tail is quite faint and diffuse, however the head has a very nice teal color.

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/Asassin101417.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Sun, 22 Oct 2017 16:45:27 +0000
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  Comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN (Oct.18,2017)
Object/Date:
Comets C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) @ Oct 18,2017 08:07 UT

Description:
Comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN photographed on October 18th 2017, just on day of its maximum approach to Earth to a distance of 0.7 A.U. (150 million kilometers) from our planet, reaching then its maximum apparent brightness with approximately magnitude 8.5. In this wide field image above a rich starry background and some dark clouds of dust into Camelopardalis constellation (The Giraffe), comet is seen with a coma near 10' diameter and a tail half degree long toward southwest.

Tech data:
Takahashi FSQ-106ED f/5.0 & SBIG STL-11000M (L:4×180s Bin1) from Mayhill, New Mexico (USA)

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/2017o1-asassn-20171018/


Clear and dark skies.

________________________________
José J. Chambó
(Valencia, Spain)

blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Thu, 26 Oct 2017 19:05:36 +0000
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  The only asteroid image I will ever post here...
Greetings Comet Friends,

We finally obtained our first image of the 18th magnitude asteroid that bears me and my wifes name. Thanks for looking!

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/ccdimagepages/asteroidSchur.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Thu, 26 Oct 2017 21:31:50 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet 24P/Schaumasse with galaxies (Oct 26th.)
Hi all,
Here is 11th mag comet 24P captured among several galaxies in Leo (NGC 3377 closest to the comet.)

The comet reaches perihelion on Nov 16th. It appears distinctly green in colour despite being rather faint.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/24p_2017_10_26dp.jpg
Best Wishes
Damian

Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/

Date:  Thu, 02 Nov 2017 20:15:06 +0000
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  Comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN  (Oct.21,2017)
Object/Date:
C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) @ Oct.21,2017 02:06 UT

Description:
Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) photographed on October 21th 2017, at time begun to go away from Sun as Earth. In spite of had a brightness drop of half magnitude until 8.5, still shown photographically a coma with 10' diameter, alhough with external layer very difuse, and also a faint tail of 20' long toward southwest.

Tech data:
GSO 8" 760mm. f/3.8 & Atik 383L+ (L:3×180s Bin1 + RGB:1x60s Bin2) from Hoya Redonda, Valencia (Spain)

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/2017o1-asassn-20171021/



Clear and dark skies.

________________________________
José J. Chambó
(Valencia, Spain)

blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo

[https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4546/26346742789_5c138795fa_b.jpg]

Adriano Valvasori

Date:  Sun, 05 Nov 2017 19:45:56 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet C/2015 ER61 (PanSTARRS) on April 28th.
Hi all,
A previously unprocessed set of data that was forgotten during a busy period back in April. A shame this was missed as the comet was looking impressive with a disconnection in the tail. Better late than never i suppose!
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2015er61_2017_04_28dp.jpg

Best Wishes
Damian *************************************************

FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro

Date:  Tue, 07 Nov 2017 17:39:16 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Five years of comets
Hi all,
Here is a mosaic showing almost all of the brighter comets ive imaged over the past five years (2012-2017.) Looking at this image if its one thing i can say its no two comets look quite the same! Among the comets here are ISON, three Lovejoy comets and several bright Panstarrs comets. We have certainly had some nice ones in recent years!
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/comets2012-2017dp.jpg

Best Wishes
Damian
 *************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

Secretary BAA Comet Section

Hi
all,
Here
is a mosaic showing almost all of the brighter comets ive
imaged over the past five years (2012-2017.) Looking at this
image if its one thing i can say its no two comets look
quite the same! Among the comets here are ISON, three
Lovejoy comets and several bright Panstarrs comets. We have
certainly had some nice ones in recent
years!
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/comets2012-2017dp.jpg

Best
Wishes
Damian

Subject: [Comet-Images] Five years of comets

Hi all,

Here is a mosaic showing almost all of the brighter comets ive imaged over
the past five years (2012-2017.) Looking at this image if its one thing i
can say its no two comets look quite the same! Among the comets here are
ISON, three Lovejoy comets and several bright Panstarrs comets. We have
certainly had some nice ones in recent years!

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/comets2012-2017dp.jpg

Best Wishes

Damian

Date:  Wed, 08 Nov 2017 09:50:14 +0100
From:  Juan Jose Gonzalez 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Five years of comets
Splendid and instructive mosaic, Damian !

Like other mosaics ( posted over the years in this site by excellent
photographers ) it shows nicely the varied morphology and colors of
comets : Swan band and dust comae, dust and ion tails, dust trails,
streamers, disconnection events, outbursts in evolution ...

It would be possible a version with larger name and time labels ?

Best regards,

Juan Jose Gonzalez

Date:  Sun, 12 Nov 2017 19:34:22 +0100
From:  Stefan Beck 
Subject:  Off-Topic: Search the image gallery of the German comet section
Hi,

I'm the maintainer of the image gallery of the German comet section.

The gallery contains more than 16.000 images from observers all over the world.

I invite every comet photographer/observer to upload
images/videos/sketches to the archive at
http://kometen.fg-vds.de/pix/test/up2_e.php

You can browse the images at http://kometen.fg-vds.de/bildere.htm

I have added a new feature. You can now search the database for the name of a comet, a designation or the name of an observer.

http://fg-kometen.vdsastro.de/pix/test/fg-suche_e.php

--
Best regards,

Stefan Beck

"Astrophotography with small telescopes"
http://www.cometchaser.de

"Image processing for Comets"
http://www.cometchaser.de/imageprocessingcomets_v2.html

"Bildbearbeitung für Kometen"
http://www.cometchaser.de/imageprocessingcomets_de_v2.html

Date:  Fri, 24 Nov 2017 00:52:59 +0000
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  Comet 24P/Schaumasse (Nov.19,2017)
Object/Date:
24P/Schaumasse @ Nov.19,2017 05:16 UT

Description:
Comet 24P/Schaumasse photographed on November 11th 2017, only two days after perihelion when reached its maximum brightness in this apparition with a magnitude near 10. In this image the comet shows a greenish coma 5' diameter with a very short tail toward left. The field has at least two dozens galaxies belonging to Virgo Galactic Cluster, highlighting at upper left corner NGC 4365, a giant eliptic galaxy located to a distance of 60 million light-years.

Tech data:
GSO 8" 760mm. f/3.8 & Atik 383L+ (L:4×120s Bin1 + RGB:1x60s Bin2) from Hoya Redonda, Valencia (Spain)

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/24p-schaumasse-20171119/

Clear and dark skies.

________________________________
José J. Chambó
(Valencia, Spain)

blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo 

Date:  Sun, 26 Nov 2017 08:53:19 +0000
From:  Adriano Valvasori 
Subject:  C/2015 ER61
Wide field image of comet C/2015 ER61 (PANSTARRS) taken on 2017-Nov-24 as it was passing across a region of the night sky with LBN 753-762 nebulae and galaxies in the constellation Aries. The comet is near the bottom center and is the object with the long tail extending to the right.

Image: https://flic.kr/p/21LjhdJ
Map: https://flic.kr/p/21NqhFu

Regards.
Adriano Valvasori.
http ://cara.uai.it/home
http ://astronomiaperpassione.blogspot.it/

2017-Nov-24 as it was passing across a region of the night

Aries. The comet is near the bottom center and is the object
with the long tail extending to the right.

Date:  Sun, 26 Nov 2017 19:06:02 +0000
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  Comet 62P/Tsuchinshan (Nov.19,2017)
Object/Date:
62P/Tsuchinshan @ Nov.19,2017 04:53 UT

Description:
Comet 62P/Tsuchinshan photographed on November 19th 2017, three days after perihelion. In its maximum shining with approx magnitude 10, shows a green coma of 6' diameter and a faint tail near 7' long toward right.

Tech data:
GSO 8" 760mm. f/3.8 & Atik 383L+ (L:4×180s Bin1 + RGB:1x60s Bin2) from Hoya Redonda, Valencia (Spain)

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/62p-tsuchinshan-20171119/

Clear and dark skies.

________________________________
José J. Chambó
(Valencia, Spain)

blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo

[cid:78522e5e-157e-4535-b0e6-5c08ed013ca9]C/2015 ER61
"Ghost " comet in wide angle 200 mm Canon lens and 6D DSLR camera.Comet conjunction with M45 , Pleiades , Seven Sisters open cluster in constellation Taurus .Mark it for you :) This version I clean up and make correction to color balance with neutral background. Thanks for looking.

[https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4414/37393685026_f5f4cebe20_b.jpg]
[https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4414/37393685026_f5f4cebe20_b.jpg]

Date:  Tue, 28 Nov 2017 00:08:30 +0000
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  Comet C/2017 O1 ASASSN  (Nov.19,2017)
Object/Date:
C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) @ Nov.19,2017 03:40 UT

Description:
Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) photographed on November 19th 2017. Its brightness has dropped clearly during the last month until magnitude 10 approximately. In this image taken when comet is going on Cepheus constellation toward celestial north pole, shows a green-bluish coma of 7' diameter and a tail also more faint and short until near 10' lenght.

Tech data:
GSO 8" 760mm. f/3.8 & Atik 383L+ (L:7×120s Bin1 + RGB:1x120s Bin2) from Hoya Redonda, Valencia (Spain)

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/2017o1-asassn-20171119/

Clear and dark skies.

________________________________
José J. Chambó
(Valencia, Spain)

blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo

Date:  Sat, 02 Dec 2017 20:38:34 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet 62P/Tsuchinshan at perihelion (Nov 16th.)
Hi all,
Here is comet 62p at perihelion alongside NGC 3524.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/62p_2017_11_16dp.jpg

Best Wishes
Damian *************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro

Date:  Tue, 05 Dec 2017 21:32:54 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comets 62P and 74P together (Nov 24th.)
Hi all,
Comets 62P and 74P recently passed very close to each other. Here they are near there closest on Nov 24th. 74P is some magnitudes fainter but does show a short dust tail.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/62p_74p_2017_11_24dp.jpg

Best Wishes
Damian *************************************************

Date:  Sat, 16 Dec 2017 11:35:07 +0100
From:  rolando ligustri 
Subject:  comet C/2016 R2 Panstarrs today from NM
in twenty years as a comet photographer, it's the first time I've seen a blue one.
the "puff" that you see in NO I think it is a remnant of the outburst a few days ago

http://spaceweathergallery.com/indiv_upload.php?upload_id=141350&PHPSESSID=1p9bp1f5ghvo1fe34588ptiir3

best regards
Rolando Ligustri

Date:  Sat, 16 Dec 2017 14:29:45 +0000
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] comet C/2016 R2 Panstarrs today from NM
Rolando, I see two streams - like jets shooting 90 degrees from the comets tail. Puffs might be a pretty good description, coming from where the core was at that time. I got Echiclus last night, but clouds rolled in here in Arizona for my attempt at this comet. Darn!

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Date:  Sat, 16 Dec 2017 22:02:53 +0700
From:  Mikhail Maslov 
Subject:  C/2016 R2 PanSTARRs on 15.12 and 17.11
C/2016 R2 PanSTARRs, indeed a very interesting blue comet.

Image from Dec 15:

http://www.astronomy.ru/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=21075.0;attach=1022717;image

You could compare it with one from Nov. 17, when for me it suddenly
turned out to be blue. Perhaps its current heightened activity was only
beginning then.

http://www.astronomy.ru/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=21075.0;attach=1016539;image

Best regards,

Mikhail Maslov 

Date:  Sat, 16 Dec 2017 16:42:04 +0000
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet 174P/ Echiclus in Aries
Hi all,

Got an hour of imaging last night, and this was a bit of a surprise, not only is the comet showing a nice green coloration, but a mystery asteroid showed up. It was not seen in Cartes du Ciel, despite the fact I have a huge asteroid data base installed. Anyone tell me what this is? the photo was taken December 15 at 19h 08m MST last night.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Sat, 16 Dec 2017 19:09:04 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet C/2016 R2 (PanSTARRS) on Dec 14th.
Hi all,
A rather strange looking comet (i think it had recently underwent an outburst.) Some interesting structure is seen.
The strong blue colour is real - rather odd looking as the coma around the nucleus shows no typical green colouration that you often see.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2016_r2_2017_12_14dp.jpg

20"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. 30min total.

Best Wishes
Damian

*************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
************************************************* 
Date:  Sat, 16 Dec 2017 19:27:31 +0000
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Comet C/2016 R2 (PanSTARRS) on Dec 14th.
Spectacular! I have never seen anything quite like this one.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

#yiv2303682970

Hi
all,
A
rather strange looking comet (i think it had recently
underwent an outburst.) Some interesting structure is
seen.
The
strong blue colour is real - rather odd looking as the coma
around the nucleus shows no typical green colouration that
you often see.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2016_r2_2017_12_14dp.jpg

20"CDK
with FLI camera. LRGB. 30min total.

Best
Wishes
Damian

*************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk

Date:  Sun, 17 Dec 2017 15:06:34 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet 174P/Echeclus on Dec 16th.
Hi all,
Here is an image of 174P obtained on Dec 16th. I accidentally shot the data in bin2 but it turned out ok none the less. Interesting dark fan shaped feature near the nucleus.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/174p_2017_12_16dp.jpg

1m RC with FLI camera. LRGB. 30min total.
Best Wishes
Damian

Subject:  174P (Echeclus) - 2017 Dec 17 UT
Hi,

Here’s a link to an image of 174P (Echeclus) taken from New Zealand last night – 2017 Dec 17 UT. 35cm f10 SCT, STL11000M, 35 x 3 minute, Clear, 2x2. The astrometry is below -

http://spaceweathergallery.com/indiv_upload.php?upload_id=141393

COD E94
CON John Drummond, Possum Observatory, Patutahi, Gisborne, New Zealand [john_drummond@xtra.co.nz]

Subject:  Comet C/2016 R2 on Dec 16th.

Here is an image of C/2016 R2 from Dec 16th. Some interesting details in the tail. Looks like a disconnection event. Needed more exposure time really.

1m F8. FLI camera. LRGB. 15mins total.

Hi
all,
Here
is an image of C/2016 R2 from Dec 16th. Some interesting
details in the tail. Looks like a disconnection event.
Needed more exposure time really.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2016_r2_2017_12_16dp.jpg

1m
F8. FLI camera. LRGB. 15mins total.
Best
Wishes
Damian *************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

Date:  Thu, 21 Dec 2017 20:02:33 +0000
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  174P/Echeclus in outburst (Dec.15,2017)
Object/Date:
174P/Echeclus @ Dec.15,2017 01:07 UT

Description:
Comet 174P/Echeclus photographed on December 15th 2017, during its last outburst. Discovered in 2000 was classified as an asteroid Centaur type circulating between orbits of Uranus and Jupiter, but years later it showed cometary activity with outbursts in 2006, 2011, 2016 and the present in 2017.

Besides of brightness increase from 17.5 to 13.5 magnitude the most remarkable has been the increase in coma size from 10 to 40 arcseconds. Thanks to resolution of Telescope IAC-80 in this image can be seen the internal structure of coma, wich shows jets departing from nucleus and a dark shape toward South.

IAC-80, Teide Observatory, Canary Islands
Paula Sola & José J. Chambó

Post and image link:
http://cometografia.es/174p-echeclus-20171215/

Clear and dark skies.

________________________________
José J. Chambó
(Valencia, Spain)

blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo
facebook: facebook.com/JoseJChambo

Date:  Fri, 22 Dec 2017 18:16:04 +0000
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet C/2016 Panstarrs R2 last night
Hi all,

No big gas puffs or parabolic envelopes, but a nice set of rays coming out of the coma.

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/PanstarrsR2-122117.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

#yiv6798509303 .yiv6798509303MsoChpDefault
{font-size:10.0pt;}
_filtered #yiv6798509303 {margin:70.85pt 2.0cm 2.0cm
2.0cm;}
#yiv6798509303 div.yiv6798509303WordSection1
{}
#yiv6798509303
_filtered #yiv6798509303 {}
_filtered #yiv6798509303 {font-family:Symbol;}
_filtered #yiv6798509303 {}
_filtered #yiv6798509303 {font-family:Wingdings;}
#yiv6798509303 ol
{margin-bottom:0cm;}

{margin-bottom:0cm;}
#yiv6798509303

Great image Chris.

Regards, Adriano

Da: Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com]

Inviato: venerdì 22 dicembre 2017 19:16

A: Comet Group ;
Comet Mailing List

Oggetto: [Comet-Images] Comet C/2016 Panstarrs R2
last night

Hi all,

No big gas puffs or parabolic envelopes, but a nice set of
rays coming out of the coma.

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/PanstarrsR2-122117.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Sat, 23 Dec 2017 21:15:57 +0700
From:  Mikhail Maslov 
Subject:  C/2017 S6 on 19.12 - in outburst?
The comet C/2017 S6 Catalina seems to be in outburst, as it is notable
brighter than 15.9 mag expected from its ephemeris
(http://aerith.net/comet/catalog/2017S6/2017S6.html), perhaps it is 13
mag now, and its coma even shows some greenish color.

http://www.astronomy.ru/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=21075.0;attach=1024410;image

Best regards,

Mikhail Maslov 

Date:  Sat, 23 Dec 2017 21:23:38 +0700
From:  Mikhail Maslov 
Subject:  C/2017 S6 on 19.12 - boosted colors
A photo with boosted colors, green coma is visible more distinctly here

http://www.astronomy.ru/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=21075.0;attach=1024416;image

Best regards,

Mikhail Maslov 

Date:  Sun, 24 Dec 2017 06:16:44 +0000
From:  hiroc070717@yahoo.com
Subject:  C/2016 R2 had wide-spread strong bluish tail on December 21, 2017
Here are frames with a telescope and a telephoto lens.
https://www.flickr.com/photos/hiroc/38337810635 https://www.flickr.com/photos/hiroc/38337810635
https://www.flickr.com/photos/hiroc/27477859929 https://www.flickr.com/photos/hiroc/27477859929

Bluish tail was exceptionally strong and widely spread near 2 degrees at the distance. It is calculated as 0.071AUs or 10,000,000km.

Best regards,

Hisayoshi Kato

Date:  Sun, 24 Dec 2017 15:47:03 +0000
From:  Soulier Jean-FranÃ§ois 
Subject:  C/2017 S6 on 19.12 - in outburst?
Good evening Mikhail Maslov and All.

Comet C 2017 S6 was in my program last night ...

=> T200 Remote, France.
20171223.78, 120x60s, without filter, in 1.65"/Pix
m2 : 18.3 (+/- 0.5), Opening radius : 6.6"
Coma : +/- 40"x55"

Astrometry :
COD A77
OBS J.-F. Soulier
MEA J.-F. Soulier
TEL 0.20-m f/4 Newtonian reflector + CCD
NET UCAC-4
    CK17S060 KC2017 12 23.78316 23 04 39.75 +29 57 14.7          18.2 N      A77
    CK17S060 KC2017 12 23.82586 23 04 36.29 +29 55 09.8          18.1 N      A77
    CK17S060 KC2017 12 23.86852 23 04 32.89 +29 53 04.9          18.5 N      A77
----- end -----

Images:
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2017S6CatalinaDaubanFrance.htm

It seems weak for +/-16 of magnitude on your images ? No ?
Would it have dropped by +/-2.5 mag. in 4 days ? Dislocation ?Other observations ?
Sincerely.
SOULIER Jean-François
C10/W96/A77

De : "Mikhail Maslov feraj@yandex.ru [Comet-Images]"
À : Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Envoyé le : Samedi 23 décembre 2017 15h15
Objet : [Comet-Images] C/2017 S6 on 19.12 - in outburst?

  The comet C/2017 S6 Catalina seems to be in outburst, as it is notable
brighter than 15.9 mag expected from its ephemeris
(http://aerith.net/comet/catalog/2017S6/2017S6.html), perhaps it is 13
mag now, and its coma even shows some greenish color.

http://www.astronomy.ru/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=21075.0;attach=1024410;image

Best regards,

Mikhail Maslov

Date:  Sun, 24 Dec 2017 23:30:00 +0700
From:  Mikhail Maslov 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2017 S6 on 19.12 - in outburst?
Dear Jean-Fran�ois Souler,

It is very interesting, many thanks for your results. My images are not
dislocated, the bright red star in the right upper angle is V345 Pegasi
(HD 218742), C/2017 S6 was passing nearby it at the time of my capture,
and it looks much brighter than I would expect from a 16 mag comet, so I
suggested it had undergone an outburst.

Your image shows a faint object again. Suggesting both your and my
images are correct, I don't know how to explain such a behavior of this
comet, particularly such brightness changes in so short periods of time.
Maybe some additional observations will help.

Best regards,

Mikhail Maslov

Date:  Sun, 24 Dec 2017 16:45:02 +0000
From:  Soulier Jean-FranÃ§ois 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2017 S6 on 19.12 - in outburst?
Thank you for this additional information ...

I did not speak of your images, but of the pseudo nucleus of the comet by using the word : dislocate.
To explain perhaps the degradation of light ...
Yes, it would be nice to have data between these two dates.
F. Kugel, could also image this comet at the same time as me, but with a larger opening x2.http://lesia.obspm.fr/comets/lib/display-obs1.php?Num=18680
Sincerely.
SOULIER Jean-François

De : "Mikhail Maslov feraj@yandex.ru [Comet-Images]"
À : Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com; comets-ml@yahoogroups.com
Envoyé le : Dimanche 24 décembre 2017 17h30
Objet : Re: [Comet-Images] C/2017 S6 on 19.12 - in outburst?

  Dear Jean-François Souler, It is very interesting, many thanks for your results. My images are not dislocated, the bright red star in the right upper angle is V345 Pegasi (HD 218742), C/2017 S6 was passing nearby it at the time of my capture, and it looks much brighter than I would expect from a 16 mag comet, so I suggested it had undergone an outburst. Your image shows a faint object again. Suggesting both your and my images are correct, I don't know how to explain such a behavior of this comet, particularly such brightness changes in so short periods of time. Maybe some additional observations will help. Best regards, Mikhail Maslov

24.12.2017 22:47, Soulier Jean-FranÃ§ois jeffcomete@yahoo.com [Comet-Images] пишет:

Good evening Mikhail Maslov and All.

Comet C 2017 S6 was in my program last night ...

=> T200 Remote, France.
20171223.78, 120x60s, without filter, in 1.65"/Pix
m2 : 18.3 (+/- 0.5), Opening radius : 6.6"
Coma : +/- 40"x55"

Astrometry :
COD A77
OBS J.-F. Soulier
MEA J.-F. Soulier
TEL 0.20-m f/4 Newtonian reflector + CCD
NET UCAC-4
    CK17S060 KC2017 12 23.78316 23 04 39.75 +29 57 14.7          18.2 N      A77
    CK17S060 KC2017 12 23.82586 23 04 36.29 +29 55 09.8          18.1 N      A77
    CK17S060 KC2017 12 23.86852 23 04 32.89 +29 53 04.9          18.5 N      A77
----- end -----

Images:
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2017S6CatalinaDaubanFrance.htm

It seems weak for +/-16 of magnitude on your images ? No ?
Would it have dropped by +/-2.5 mag. in 4 days ? Dislocation ? Other observations ?
Sincerely.
SOULIER Jean-François
C10/W96/A77

De : "Mikhail Maslov feraj@yandex.ru [Comet-Images]"
À : Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Envoyé le : Samedi 23 décembre 2017 15h15
Objet : [Comet-Images] C/2017 S6 on 19.12 - in outburst?

  The comet C/2017 S6 Catalina seems to be in outburst, as it is notable
brighter than 15.9 mag expected from its ephemeris
(http://aerith.net/comet/catalog/2017S6/2017S6.html), perhaps it is 13
mag now, and its coma even shows some greenish color.

http://www.astronomy.ru/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=21075.0;attach=1024410;image

Best regards,

Mikhail Maslov

De : "Mikhail Maslov feraj@yandex.ru [Comet-Images]"
À : Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com; comets-ml@yahoogroups.com
Envoyé le : Dimanche 24 décembre 2017 17h30
Objet : Re: [Comet-Images] C/2017 S6 on 19.12 - in outburst?

  Dear Jean-François Souler, It is very interesting, many thanks for your results. My images are not dislocated, the bright red star in the right upper angle is V345 Pegasi (HD 218742), C/2017 S6 was passing nearby it at the time of my capture, and it looks much brighter than I would expect from a 16 mag comet, so I suggested it had undergone an outburst. Your image shows a faint object again. Suggesting both your and my images are correct, I don't know how to explain such a behavior of this comet, particularly such brightness changes in so short periods of time. Maybe some additional observations will help. Best regards, Mikhail Maslov

24.12.2017 22:47, Soulier Jean-FranÃ§ois jeffcomete@yahoo..com [Comet-Images] пишет:

{font-family:Verdana;}#yiv0205358225 #yiv0205358225ygrp-msg p#yiv0205358225attach-count span {color:#1E66AE;font-weight:700;}#yiv0205358225 #yiv0205358225ygrp-reco #yiv0205358225reco-head {color:#ff7900;font-weight:700;}#yiv0205358225 #yiv0205358225ygrp-reco {margin-bottom:20px;padding:0px;}#yiv0205358225 #yiv0205358225ygrp-sponsor #yiv0205358225ov li a {font-size:130%;text-decoration:none;}#yiv0205358225 #yiv0205358225ygrp-sponsor #yiv0205358225ov li {font-size:77%;list-style-type:square;padding:6px 0;}#yiv0205358225 #yiv0205358225ygrp-sponsor #yiv0205358225ov ul {margin:0;padding:0 0 0 8px;}#yiv0205358225 #yiv0205358225ygrp-text {font-family:Georgia;}#yiv0205358225 #yiv0205358225ygrp-text p {margin:0 0 1em 0;}#yiv0205358225 #yiv0205358225ygrp-text tt {font-size:120%;}#yiv0205358225 #yiv0205358225ygrp-vital ul li:last-child {border-right:none !important;}#yiv0205358225

Date:  Tue, 26 Dec 2017 08:35:36 +0000
From:  hiroc070717@yahoo.com
Subject:  Re: C/2016 R2 dec 24
Thanks for your presentation. I hope to enjoy nice development of this comet in 2018.

Hisayoshi Kato
Date:  Tue, 26 Dec 2017 18:19:11 +0000
From:  schmidtcamera250070@yahoo.com
Subject:  2016 R2 dec 25 GIF
Hello

I had one of the rare clear nights in December yesterday. The seeing was good, the transparency excellent. As ordered, a knot and a bowl-shaped structure moved away from the comet. The animations show the movement
from UT 22.14-00.32 with a 10"/f 4 Newton. All images (42) are taken with blue filter.

Regards
Michael Jäger

GIF
http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=michael-jAcger-2016r2stellardec25mj-iloveimg-compressed_1514311824.gif http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=michael-jAcger-2016r2stellardec25mj-iloveimg-compressed_1514311824.gif

high contrast
http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=michael-jAcger-2016r2dec25highcontrastGIF-iloveimg-resized-iloveimg-compressed-1_1514311633.gif http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=michael-jAcger-2016r2dec25highcontrastGIF-iloveimg-resized-iloveimg-compressed-1_1514311633.gif 

Date:  Tue, 26 Dec 2017 22:35:23 +0100
From:  Michael Jaeger 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Re: C/2016 R2 dec 24
Dear Hisayhoshi Kato
January and February, the chances are very good.
The comet and its tail have brightened over the past month.
It does not look like the outbursts are coming to an end.
Michael Jäger

Date:  Thu, 28 Dec 2017 18:38:01 +0100
From:  Michael Jaeger 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 2016 R2 dec 25 high contrast GIF
Dear comet friends, thanks for your comments.
I am currently testing the CMOS chip. He is in the blue area
very intensive. Currently I use unity gain. But it could be
that higher gains bring even more. The effect is strong,
if you add three or more frames. Regards Michael

and
